availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William F. Toms (Washington County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Washington County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Married to Minerva Williams Toms. Father of Elizabeth Toms, Zenobia Toms, Jessie Toms, James Toms, Mary "Polly" Toms, Sarah Toms, and Catherine Toms. Farmer in Washington County, Kentucky in 1850. Farmer in Washington County in 1863. Served in the Mercer County State Guards (U.S.A.) from December 7, 1864, to May 12, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Washington County, p. 143A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Washington County, Pottsville, p. 379B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Washington County, KY, 1863, p. 188.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994057, Washington County Births.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 798.
